news.title: ‘They thought they were gods. Untouchable’ – killer Ruth Lawrence planned to flee to Peru with boyfriend while on the run in South Africa
news.summary: Double murderer Ruth Lawrence was investigated over a hostage incident while on the run from gardaí in which two people were held against their will and terrorised.

news.title: Report on alleged cheating in electrician apprenticeship exams referred to gardaí
news.summary: A report into alleged cheating in electrical apprenticeship exams has been referred to the gardaí by Quality and ­Qualifications Ireland (QQI), the  Irish Independent  can reveal.

news.title: Fionnán Sheahan: Allowing Simon Harris to appoint himself to Finance is a symptom of Micheál Martin’s weakness
news.summary: The leader’s loyalists are blaming the dissidents for stirring the pot on Micheál Martin. “A small number of people are out to destroy Fianna Fáil,” a senior party figure reportedly told a behind-closed-doors local meeting.

news.title: Conor McKeon: Fans wanted – must be loaded. Should the IRFU charge so much just because it can?
news.summary: Let us take a moment here to review the autumn international series, where Ireland either did or didn’t beat the same teams that they did or didn’t beat last year and/or the time before that.

news.title: Home-heating oil prices shoot up just as cold snap hits the country
news.summary: The cost of home-heating oil has spiked just as the country is being hit by a cold snap.

news.title: ‘World-renowned’ expert to chair panel examining children who had hip dysplasia surgery – but some will be excluded
news.summary: An expert review panel to examine thousands of children who had hip dysplasia surgery is almost finalised – but many will be excluded, including those who had operations in Crumlin hospital, it has emerged.

news.title: ‘I could have been arrested for bigamy’ – stories from the 1995 divorce referendum
news.summary: A divorce campaigner and mother of three has recalled how she could have been arrested for bigamy by simply crossing the Border before the successful 1995 referendum.

news.title: Debbie Deegan: I’d had a stroke and my voice was gone. I was lying there thinking, ‘If I’ve no voice, what am I?’
news.summary: Debbie Deegan had tried lion’s mane mushrooms for the first time, for breakfast. “The second I ate it, I felt wonky. I said to the food group, ‘I feel like I’m drunk’”

news.title: ‘It was a racket. But it was a racket RTÉ started.’ Myles Dungan on freelance contracts, losing ‘Late Date’ and moving into fiction writing
news.summary: For the most part, Myles ­Dungan is reliably sardonic and self-deprecating. The writing of his excellent new novel,  The Red Branch , a historical espionage thriller about ­“Fenians who are at it again” in 19th-century San Francisco, sprung from “the joy of making shit up”.

news.title: Ask Allison: My husband won’t seek help for his mental health issues and it’s affecting our relationship
news.summary: My husband is in his mid 40s and has very obvious mental-health struggles. He can’t relax or stay still for any length of time and has always been this way. Now, however, this comes with cycles of weeks of being low and blaming me for his sadness or negative feelings.
